properties.Name: Staten Island Ferry Whitehall Terminal
properties.description: This post is a guide to taking the Staten Island Ferry, a free ferry. We share insider tips such as the best time to take the ferry and where to stand for the best views of the Statue of Liberty and Lower Manhattan. This is #2 on our top 10 free things to do in NYC. https://freetoursbyfoot.com/staten-island-ferry/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapSIFerry&utm_medium=referral.

properties.Name: National Museum of the American Indian
properties.description: The National Museum of the American Indian was a private collection of Native American artifacts — actually the collection was the largest in the world with more than 800,000 artifacts — before it was transferred to the Smithsonian in 1989. The museum has two branches, in Washington, DC, and New York, NY, and a collections facility in Suitland, MD. https://freetoursbyfoot.com/national-museum-of-the-american-indian-new-york/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapAmericanIndian&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: Charging Bull
properties.description: This post is about how to find the Wall Street Bull, officially known as the Charging Bull, the popular bronze statue and financial icon, along with a brief history of the Bull and the Fearless Girl Statue.” https://freetoursbyfoot.com/wall-street-bull/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapCharginBull&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: Trinity Church

properties.Name: Federal Hall
properties.description: The corner of Wall Street and Nassau street has been the site of government activity and played a prominent place in American history for more than 300 years. So many significant events of early America occurred at the buildings that have stood at this location including the first stirrings of pre-Revolution discontent and the post-Revolution formation of our federal government. This was the site of George Washington’s inauguration and the place where the Bill of Rights was officially passed. Though the original building that served as the nation’s first capitol is gone, the current grandiose Federal Hall building serves as a national memorial to the events that occurred here.  https://freetoursbyfoot.com/federal-hall-national-memorial-nyc/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapFederalHall&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: Wall St. and New York Stock Exchange

properties.Name: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
properties.description: This post explains how to take a free tour of the Federal Reserve Building in NYC, including tips on hours, how to get here, as well as other tips to help you plan your visit. A tour of the vaults is listed among the top free things to do in NYC.  https://freetoursbyfoot.com/new-york-federal-reserve-bank-tour/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapCityFederalReserve&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: South Street Seaport Museum
properties.description: This post is a self-guided tour will take you through the South Street Seaport area, one of the oldest and most historic neighborhoods in New York City. Much of the area is filled with restored 19th-century buildings along cobblestone streets. In 1967, the South Street Seaport Museum was founded to preserve many of the buildings, ships, monuments, and the overall historic area which has become a popular destination for visitors and locals alike.  https://freetoursbyfoot.com/south-street-seaport-new-york-city/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapSouthStreet&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: Brooklyn Bridge
properties.description: Learn how to plan for walking across the Brooklyn Bridge, how to get to it, where to start, when to go, what else there is to do around the bridge. Be sure to consider our daily guided tour and our GPS-enabled audio tour of the Brooklyn Bridge.  https://freetoursbyfoot.com/walking-the-brooklyn-bridge/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMap&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: 9/11 Memorial
properties.description: In this post, we detail how to visit the National September 11th Memorial, also known as the 9/11 Memorial, World Trade Center Memorial, the Ground Zero Memorial, or the Twin Towers Memorial, including tours you can take, and nearby attractions you may want to see. https://freetoursbyfoot.com/visit-911-memorial-nyc/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMap911&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: New York City Hall
properties.description: New York’s City Hall, located in Lower Manhattan, is the country’s oldest city hall that is still used for its original purpose. While most of the city government offices are now housed in the big, magnificent Municipal Building, the Office of the Mayor and the City Council Chambers are still located in the City Hall building.  https://freetoursbyfoot.com/new-york-city-hall-tours/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapCityHallTours&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: African Burial Ground National Historic Monument
Friends Apartment

properties.Name: The High Line
properties.description: This post is a visitor’s guide to the High Line, a city park on an abandoned elevated freight rail line in the middle of NYC, including tips on planning your visit. https://freetoursbyfoot.com/high-line-map/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapHighLine&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: Flatiron Building
properties.description: This post is about the Flatiron Building in NYC, including its history, how to get here, tips on the best photo spots, and nearby attractions. https://freetoursbyfoot.com/flatiron-building-new-york-city/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapFlatiron&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: New York Public Library - Stephen A. Schwarzman Building
properties.description: This post is about how to take a free tour of the New York Public Library’s main branch building, including tips on how to get here and what you will see. https://freetoursbyfoot.com/new-york-city-public-library-tours/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapPublicLibrary&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: Grand Central Terminal
properties.description: This post is a guide to Grand Central Terminal and what you can see and do there, including taking a tour, enjoy some food, architecture, and of course, catch a train. We have put together this guide with a mini-tour to help familiarize you with this grand space or consider using our audio tour to guide you through the terminal. https://freetoursbyfoot.com/grand-central-terminal/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapGrandCentral&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: Chrysler Building
properties.description: This post is a visitor’s guide to the Chrysler Building. We cover its history, how to get to it, and what there is to see. While it’s technically not possible to go up the Chrysler Building, as a tourist anyway, we have a secret tip on how to get a view of New York City from its top.  https://freetoursbyfoot.com/visit-the-chrysler-building/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapCityChrysler&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: Times Square
properties.description: This post covers things to do in Times Square with sections on free and night activities, shopping, restaurants, and a Times Square map and self-guided walking tour. Below you will find lots of information about Times Square so you know about all the great happenings! Be sure to check out our Things to Do in NYC for more ideas.   https://freetoursbyfoot.com/things-to-do-in-times-square/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapCityTimesSquare&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: Rockefeller Center
properties.description: This post is an overview and review of guided tours of Rockefeller Center. We also included a self-guided tour that you could use to go on your own. We also provide links to other Rockefeller Center content, such as Radio City Music Hall, Top of the Rock, and the NBC Studios Tour.  https://freetoursbyfoot.com/rockefeller-center-tours/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapCityRockefellerCenter&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: The Late Show with Stephen Colbert
properties.description: This post is about how to get tickets to New York TV shows. While visiting NYC, not only do you have the opportunity to see amazing sights, you can attend the live filming of some of your favorite TV shows! Saturday Night Live, Good Morning America, the Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon and more film in New York City and offer travelers the opportunity to be a part of their studio audience.  https://freetoursbyfoot.com/new-york-tv-show-tickets/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapTVShows&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: Roosevelt Island Tram
properties.description: This post is a guide to riding the Roosevelt Island Tram, which some might refer to as a cable car or gondola, including tips on where to board and when to go. And the trip costs the same as a ride on the subway.   https://freetoursbyfoot.com/roosevelt-island-tramway/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapCityRooseveltIslandTram&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: Central Park
properties.description: This post covers things to do and see in Central Park. While we offer many different guided Central Park tours, we know that many travelers prefer to explore on their own at their own pace. This self-guided tour and list of things to do in Central Park will help you make the most of your visit to this incredible New York iconic location.  https://freetoursbyfoot.com/things-to-do-in-central-park/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapCP&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: Strawberry Fields
properties.description: This post will help you located Strawberry Fields in Central Park. Strawberry Fields is located between West 71st Street and Wests 74th Street at the West 72nd Street entrance to Central Park. It has become a “must-see” for many tourists visiting New York City. Strawberry Fields is a stop on our audio tour of Central Park.  https://freetoursbyfoot.com/strawberry-fields-central-park/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapCityStrawberryFields&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture
Gospel at the Abyssinian Baptist Church
properties.description: This post describes how you could hear gospel music in New York, whether in Harlem, in Brooklyn or anywhere else. If this seems daunting, you might consider an organized gospel tour. We also cover several gospel churches on our pay-what-you-wish Harlem Walking Tour as well as on our audio tour of Harlem. https://freetoursbyfoot.com/where-to-hear-gospel-music-in-new-york-city/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapGospelAbsynnia&utm_medium=referral

properties.Name: The Bushwick Collective
properties.description: This post explains the Bushwick Collective, NYC’s most prolific neighborhood for street art and graffiti, and how to reach it. Check out our pay-what-you-like New York Graffiti and Street Art Tour (tour video below).  https://freetoursbyfoot.com/bushwick-graffiti-bushwick-collective/?utm_source=NYCAttractionsMapBushwickCollective&utm_medium=referral
